Package primitives

Class Point

java.lang.Object
primitives.Point
public class Point
extends java.lang.Object
The Point class represents a Point in three dimensional space.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static Point ORIGIN
    Represents the Point (0, 0, 0)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Point​(double x, double y, double z)
    Constructs a Point from three Coordinates' values.
    Point​(Coordinate x, Coordinate y, Coordinate z)
    Constructs a Point from three Coordinates.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Point add​(Vector v)
    Adds a Vector to this Point and returns the resulting Point.
    double distance​(Point target)
    Calculates the distance between this Point and the target Point.
    boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
    Checks if the two Points are in the same three dimensional space.
    int hashCode()
    Computes the hash function based on that of the array of Coordinates.
    double squareDistance​(Point target)
    The square of the distance between this Point and the target Point.
    double sum()
    Calculates the sum of the three Coordinates this Point is made up of.
    java.lang.String toString()
    Returns the Point as a string in the cartesian representation, e.g.
    Point transform​(CoordinateTransformation transformation)
    Similar to transform(CoordinateTransformation, Point) but does not require an auxiliary Point, since the transformation when called in this way is not supposed to depend on a second Coordinate.
    Point transform​(CoordinateTransformation transformation, Point auxiliary)
    Creates a new Point which is a transformation of this Point by applying the given transformation to each of the Coordinates.
    Vector vectorFrom​(Point source)
    Constructs a Vector from the given Point to this Point.
    Vector vectorTo​(Point target)
    Constructs a Vector from this Point to the given Point.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, finalize, getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • ORIGIN

      public static final Point ORIGIN
      Represents the Point (0, 0, 0)

  • Constructor Details

    • Point

      public Point​(Coordinate x, Coordinate y, Coordinate z)
      Constructs a Point from three Coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate.
      y - The y-coordinate.
      z - The z-coordinate.

    • Point

      public Point​(double x, double y, double z)
      Constructs a Point from three Coordinates' values.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate value.
      y - The y-coordinate value.
      z - The z-coordinate value.

  • Method Details

    • transform

      public Point transform​(CoordinateTransformation transformation, Point auxiliary)
      Creates a new Point which is a transformation of this Point by applying the given transformation to each of the Coordinates.
      Parameters:
      transformation - A function which receives two Coordinates and returns another Coordinate.
      auxiliary - An auxiliary Point whose corresponding Coordinate may (or may not) be used in the transformation function in order to calculate each of the new Coordinates.
      Returns:
      The Point made up of applying the transformation to each of the three Coordinates.

    • transform

      public Point transform​(CoordinateTransformation transformation)
      Similar to transform(CoordinateTransformation, Point) but does not require an auxiliary Point, since the transformation when called in this way is not supposed to depend on a second Coordinate.
      Parameters:
      transformation - A function which receives two Coordinates and returns another Coordinate.
      Returns:
      The Point made up of applying the transformation to each of the three Coordinates.

    • add

      public Point add​(Vector v)
      Adds a Vector to this Point and returns the resulting Point.
      Parameters:
      v - The Vector to add to this Point.
      Returns:
      The Point resulting from adding the Vector to this Point.

    • vectorTo

      public Vector vectorTo​(Point target)
      Constructs a Vector from this Point to the given Point.
      Parameters:
      target - The Coordinate where the Vector is to end, if it were to start from this Point.
      Returns:
      The Vector from this Point to the given Point.
      Throws:
      ZeroVectorException - if the target is equal to this Point.

    • vectorFrom

      public Vector vectorFrom​(Point source)
      Constructs a Vector from the given Point to this Point.
      Parameters:
      source - The Coordinate where the Vector is to start, if it were to end at this Point.
      Returns:
      The Vector to this Point from the given Point.
      Throws:
      ZeroVectorException - if the source is equal to this Point.

    • distance

      public double distance​(Point target)
      Calculates the distance between this Point and the target Point.
      Parameters:
      target - The Point to calculate the distance to.
      Returns:
      The distance between this Point and the target Point.

    • squareDistance

      public double squareDistance​(Point target)
      The square of the distance between this Point and the target Point. This number is much more efficient to compute than distance(primitives.Point) since it does not involve a square root.
      Parameters:
      target - The Point to calculate the distance to.
      Returns:
      The square of the distance between this Point and the target Point.

    • sum

      public double sum()
      Calculates the sum of the three Coordinates this Point is made up of.
      Returns:
      The sum of the three Coordinates this Point is made up of.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
      Checks if the two Points are in the same three dimensional space.
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Computes the hash function based on that of the array of Coordinates.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class java.lang.Object

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the Point as a string in the cartesian representation, e.g. "(0, 0, 0)"
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
